title: (x) Electric Six "Switzerland" album cover - Helvetica {Marc O}
content:
Heya! I’m doing a project on the Swiss School, and was wondering which fort was used on the Electric Six album cover, Switzerland?

[http://images.amazon.com/images/P/B000H7JABG.01.\_SCLZZZZZZZ\_V41117481\_.j...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821122850/http:/images.amazon.com/images/P/B000H7JABG.01._SCLZZZZZZZ_V41117481_.jpg "http://images.amazon.com/images/P/B000H7JABG.01.\_SCLZZZZZZZ\_V41117481\_.jpg")

help would be appreciated!

 [‹ (x) Tate & Barbican Gallery fonts - Futura, San Serif Shaded {Adriano S, Lex, Thomas Binder, Mike F}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821122850/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38113 "Go to previous forum topic") [Soft Script on Del Monte SunFresh Label ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080821122850/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38183 "Go to next forum topic")
author: s7409651

comments.content: I’m pretty sure that’s our good friend Helvetica.
yes..hmm. i guess the variant of Helvetica I have is..not this one then. the ’t’ is whats bugging me. Thanks for the help!
Helvetica Neue Ultra Light Condensed is the anwser.
